004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.util.AllocationException;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/**
016 * Solenoid class for running high voltage Digital Output on the PCM.
017 *
018 * <p>The Solenoid class is typically used for pneumatic solenoids, but could be used for any device
019 * within the current spec of the PCM.
020 */
021public class Solenoid implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
022  private final int m_mask; // The channel mask
023  private final int m_channel;
024  private PneumaticsBase m_module;
025
026  /**
027   * Constructor.
028   *
029   * @param module The PCM the solenoid is attached to.
030   * @param channel The channel on the PCM to control (0..7).
031   */
032  public Solenoid(PneumaticsBase module, final int channel) {
033    m_module = Objects.requireNonNull(module, "Module cannot be null");
034
035    if (!module.checkSolenoidChannel(channel)) {
036      throw new IllegalArgumentException(); // TODO fix me
037    }
038
039    m_mask = 1 << channel;
040    m_channel = channel;
041
042    if (module.checkAndReserveSolenoids(m_mask) != 0) {
043      throw new AllocationException("Solenoid already allocated");
044    }
045
046    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Solenoid, channel + 1, module.getModuleNumber() + 1);
047    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "Solenoid", module.getModuleNumber(), channel);
048  }
049
050  @Override
051  public void close() {
052    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
053    m_module.unreserveSolenoids(m_mask);
054    m_module = null;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Set the value of a solenoid.
059   *
060   * @param on True will turn the solenoid output on. False will turn the solenoid output off.
061   */
062  public void set(boolean on) {
063    int value = on ? (0xFFFF & m_mask) : 0;
064    m_module.setSolenoids(m_mask, value);
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Read the current value of the solenoid.
069   *
070   * @return True if the solenoid output is on or false if the solenoid output is off.
071   */
072  public boolean get() {
073    int currentAll = m_module.getSolenoids();
074    return (currentAll & m_mask) != 0;
075  }
076
077  /**
078   * Toggle the value of the solenoid.
079   *
080   * <p>If the solenoid is set to on, it'll be turned off. If the solenoid is set to off, it'll be
081   * turned on.
082   */
083  public void toggle() {
084    set(!get());
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Get the channel this solenoid is connected to.
089   *
090   * @return The channel this solenoid is connected to.
091   */
092  public int getChannel() {
093    return m_channel;
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Check if solenoid is DisabledListed. If a solenoid is shorted, it is added to the Disabled List
098   * and disabled until power cycle, or until faults are cleared.
099   *
100   * @return If solenoid is disabled due to short.
101   */
102  public boolean isDisabled() {
103    return (m_module.getSolenoidDisabledList() & m_mask) != 0;
104  }
105
106  /**
107   * Set the pulse duration in the PCM. This is used in conjunction with the startPulse method to
108   * allow the PCM to control the timing of a pulse. The timing can be controlled in 0.01 second
109   * increments.
110   *
111   * @param durationSeconds The duration of the pulse, from 0.01 to 2.55 seconds.
112   * @see #startPulse()
113   */
114  public void setPulseDuration(double durationSeconds) {
115    long durationMS = (long) (durationSeconds * 1000);
116    m_module.setOneShotDuration(m_channel, (int) durationMS);
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Trigger the PCM to generate a pulse of the duration set in setPulseDuration.
121   *
122   * @see #setPulseDuration(double)
123   */
124  public void startPulse() {
125    m_module.fireOneShot(m_channel);
126  }
127
128  @Override
129  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
130    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Solenoid");
131    builder.setActuator(true);
132    builder.setSafeState(() -> set(false));
133    builder.addBooleanProperty("Value", this::get, this::set);
134  }
135}
